alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 3:21PM CDT until April 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Rapid rises along Big Sugar Creek are expected downstream from Powell to it`s confluence with Indian Creek. The gauge at Powell measured rapid rises indicative of flooding, which will continue downstream from Powell. While no additional rain is expected, flooding along Big Sugar Creek will continue over the next few hours. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, McDonald. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 PM CDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Big Sugar Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
